messages.content:
how do i login and clone this with my token? (base) root@server1:~# cd /home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com/
(base) root@server1:/home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com# git clone https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git
Cloning into 'JsonSlidesMaker'...
Username for 'https://github.com': bilalghalib
Password for 'https://bilalghalib@github.com': 
remote: Invalid username or token. Password authentication is not supported for Git operations.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git/'
(base) root@server1:/home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com# 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@github.com/bilalghalib/
-bash: 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@github.com/bilalghalib/: No such file or directory
(base) root@server1:/home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com#

You’ve got two easy ways. The quickest is to let Git prompt you and paste your **PAT** as the password (that still works—plain passwords don’t).

### Option A — Prompted login (clean, no token in URL)
```bash
cd /home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com

# start the clone
git clone https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git
# When asked:
#   Username: bilalghalib
#   Password: <paste your PAT here>
```
If it still says “Invalid username or token,” the PAT likely lacks scope or is expired. For a **private** repo, the token needs at least the `repo` scope.

### Option B — One-liner with env var (no storing token in remote or history)
```bash
cd /home/bilal/public_html/sustainableiraq.com
export GITHUB_TOKEN='your_pat_here'

git -c http.extraheader="Authorization: Bearer $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
    clone https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git

unset GITHUB_TOKEN
```
This sends the token via an Authorization header and doesn’t bake it into the remote URL.

---

### If you prefer the token-in-URL style (works, but leak-prone)
```bash
export GITHUB_TOKEN='your_pat_here'
git clone https://bilalghalib:${GITHUB_TOKEN}@github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git
unset GITHUB_TOKEN

# then immediately scrub the token from the saved remote URL:
cd JsonSlidesMaker
git remote set-url origin https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git
```

### Make pushes painless later (optional)
Use a credential helper so you don’t paste every time:
```bash
git config --global credential.helper cache   # in-memory for a while
# or
git config --global credential.helper store   # writes plain text to ~/.git-credentials
```

### Quick checklist if it fails
- PAT has `repo` scope (for private) or is still valid.
- You typed the token exactly (no extra spaces/newlines).
- Repo path is correct: `https://github.com/bilalghalib/JsonSlidesMaker.git`

Want me to walk through generating a properly scoped PAT and testing with a quick `git ls-remote`?
